thread.title: Awesome new app brings The Gruffalo to life at Delamere Forest
thread.title_full: Awesome new app brings The Gruffalo to life at Delamere Forest

author: Emma Gill
title: Awesome new app brings The Gruffalo to life at Delamere Forest
text:
What's On Awesome new app brings The Gruffalo to life at Delamere Forest Families can follow clues on a trail and see Mouse, Snake, Fox and the Gruffalo himself come alive through their phones Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing! Could   The Gruffalo will come alive in the forest like never before thanks to a free new app. Families will be able to use it to follow clues around Delamere Forest and find the characters from the best-selling children's book by Julia Donaldson. The self-led trail is packed with facts about forest animals with activities along the way. Once families have spotted the characters, they can use the augmented reality app to bring the 3D character animation to life and take photos alongside them. 
The Gruffalo Spotter is the first development of its kind from the Forestry Commission England and Magic Light Pictures and has been designed for exclusive use at 26 forests across England, the nearest being Delamere where it will launch on April 1. Read More Work starts on thrilling tree-top adventure playground at Heaton Park - including mid-air trampolines 
Taking family forest walks to new heights, the app mixes technology with the real world, encouraging children to 'get exploring, firing their imaginations and enabling them to have an all-new forest experience'. 
Visitors can join the adventure through the deep dark wood, following interactive trail and track signs of their favourite characters from the book, illustrated by Axel Scheffler. Bridgette Hall, recreation manager for Forestry Commission England, said: " This is such an exciting development and will deliver a completely different forest experience for our visitors. "The Gruffalo is a world renowned story and to be able to bring the characters to life in their natural setting is fantastic. It’s great we’ve had the opportunity to join the two worlds of technology and nature together in a sensitive way." Read More You can visit Safari Zoo for FREE until the end of February Barney Goodland, head of digital at Magic Light Pictures, added: " Our partnership with Forestry Commission England has been an overwhelming success from the start so in this, our fourth year of activity, we wanted to do something really special. "We’re always looking to further children’s enjoyment of The Gruffalo brand and this was an innovative way to incorporate new technology with a real world experience." Visitors photos are automatically added to their device’s gallery, from where they can be shared via social media with the hashtag #GruffaloSpotters. The Gruffalo Spotter’s app is available for free with no in-app purchases from the App Store and Google Play. Read More A Gruffalo Spotters kit will be available to buy on site for £3 and includes animal facts, tips for tracking wildlife, an evidence collection bag, a magnifying glass and a pencil to make a note of your forest finds. 
For more details please visit www.forestry.gov.uk/gruffalo . Read More
